intro: Gagea dutoitii var. antiatlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic gagea, is a rare bulbous plant native to the coastal regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered bulbs and delicate, grass-like foliage. The plant produces bell-shaped flowers in shades of white to pale pink, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires a cool, moist environment during its growing season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
